meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>pride</kanji> and the verb version is <vocabulary>to be proud of</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to boast of</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: The <reading>hoe 子</reading> (ほこ) is the kid who is carrying around a hoe all the time, swinging it around, doing dumb things with it. He's so proud of it, though, and it shows on his face. He's always boasting about his hoe skillz too.
